name: Tyrion Lannister
description: Tyrion Lannister is the youngest child of Lord Tywin Lannister and Lady Joanna Lannister, who died giving birth to him. Born with dwarfism, Tyrion has faced scorn and mockery throughout his life, often using his sharp wit and intellect as both defense and weapon. Despite his family's disdain, he possesses a keen political mind and a surprisingly strong moral compass. Unlike many in Westeros, Tyrion strives to protect the realm and those who cannot defend themselves, even when it means opposing his own family's interests. His journey is marked by his resilience in the face of prejudice and his unwavering commitment to justice and knowledge.
memorableMoments: Slapping Prince Joffrey across the face for his disrespectful behavior.
Leading the defense of King's Landing during the Battle of Blackwater.
His trial speech where he declares, 'I wish I was the monster you think I am.'

name: Daenerys Targaryen
description:
Whether Daenerys will be remembered as a legendary savior or a formidable conqueror, her impact on Westeros is undeniable. From the start, she has been portrayed as the destined ruler of the Iron Throne, with a narrative that runs parallel to events in King's Landing. Her journey includes pivotal moments like reviving dragons, which reintroduced magic into the world.

Her ultimate role in this saga remains uncertain, but her influence on the unfolding story is undeniable. Daenerys Targaryen stands as one of the key figures shaping the series' outcome.
memorableMoments: When she emerged from Khal Drogo's funeral pyre, standing bare and accompanied by three newborn dragons.
Her commanding presence that led to victory over the Unsullied with just a single command: "Dracarys."
The first time she soared on Drogon, escaping an attack in Meereen.

name: Jon Snow
description:
Jon Snow stands out as one of Game of Thrones' most compelling characters, embodying classic heroism with his unwavering honor, kindness, intelligence, persistence, and selflessness. Time and again, he prioritizes duty over personal desires, demonstrating true leadership.

In a tragic twist, Jon is killed in a mutiny by men he once commanded. His allies resort to magic in desperation to bring him back, underscoring his importance as both a good man and their leader.

Beyond his role in the Night’s Watch, Jon's mysterious parentage adds depth to his character. Known initially as Ned Stark's illegitimate son, Jon has shown little interest in claiming the Iron Throne. However, should he discover a legitimate claim to it, along with the support of the North as "King in the North," it could lead to fascinating developments, especially when encountering Daenerys and her dragons.
memorableMoments: Discovering his white direwolf pup, Ghost, and feeling an instant connection.
Choosing to remain Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch over being legitimized as a Stark.
Being resurrected by Melisandre in Season 6, surprising everyone who believed him dead.

name: Cersei Lannister
description:
Cersei Lannister is one of Game of Thrones' most compelling and enigmatic figures. Her character blends a ruthless ambition with deep flaws and cunning intelligence. As a woman navigating the treacherous political landscape, she strives for equality in a male-dominated world. Her mantra, "when you play the game of thrones, you win or you die," has guided her actions, earning both fear and respect as she endures when more honorable figures fall.

Despite committing terrible acts and spiraling into madness, Cersei's determination to ascend the political ladder is undeniable. Her resilience in a hostile world makes her an unforgettable character in Westeros.
memorableMoments: The shocking moment Bran witnesses Cersei engaging in incest with her brother.
The infamous Walk of Shame that remains etched in memory for both fans and Cersei herself.
Despite losing much, Cersei achieves a bittersweet triumph when she finally claims the Iron Throne as queen.

name: Arya Stark
description:
Arya Stark’s journey through Game of Thrones is marked by resilience and adaptability. Despite being one of the series' least powerful principal characters, she demonstrates remarkable strength and resourcefulness. Arya has faced numerous challenges, from periods where her character development seemed to stall, to becoming a formidable survivor in Westeros.

Her ability to reinvent herself — as a water dancer, under her nickname Arry, or as a blind assassin named "No One" — highlights her versatility. Among her most compelling story arcs is her travels with the Hound, which stands out as one of the series' finest moments.
memorableMoments: Arya's initiation into killing is a pivotal moment for her character, famously instructing to 'stick him with the pointy end.'
Her rare laughter at Sansa’s departure from the Eyrie before Arya’s arrival underscores her unique perspective.
Each name crossed off her list of targets signifies her quest for vengeance, culminating in the unforgettable and satisfying death of Walder Frey.

name: Jaime Lannister
description:
Infamously known as the Kingslayer, Jaime Lannister's early actions included betraying his oath by assassinating King Aerys II. Once considered one of Westeros' greatest swordsmen, Jaime’s complex journey reveals layers beyond his initial villainous persona.

His deep, albeit controversial, love for his twin sister Cersei and a unique bond with his brother Tyrion add depth to his character. Key events — the loss of his right hand, which humbles him; the death of his father Tywin Lannister; and the tragic losses of his children — all contribute to Jaime's evolution.

His relationships with Brienne of Tarth and Bronn further illustrate his multifaceted nature, moving beyond his 'Prince Charming from Shrek' nickname. Though not completely redeemed, he is no longer the irredeemable figure he once appeared to be.
memorableMoments: His decision to push Bran Stark out a window to protect Cersei marks a turning point: 'The things we do for love.'
The loss of his sword hand in Season 3 after being captured by Locke.
Choosing loyalty over personal safety, Jaime's strategic takeover of Riverrun during its siege is pivotal.

name: Eddard Stark
description:
Eddard Stark's role in Game of Thrones is foundational, setting the tone with his unwavering commitment to honor, loyalty, and justice. His principles profoundly influence his children, many of whom become pivotal figures in Westeros' political landscape.

Ned’s tragic execution early in the series underscores a critical theme: sometimes, honor can be perilous. His legacy continues to echo throughout the story, shaping characters’ actions long after his death and serving as both a heroic archetype and a cautionary tale about the complexities of power and morality.
memorableMoments: Ned imparts a crucial lesson on honor at the series' start: 'The man who carries the sentence swings the sword.'
Ignoring advice to navigate court politics carefully, he confronts Cersei Lannister about her children's legitimacy.
His shocking execution in Season 1’s penultimate episode marks one of television's most unexpected twists.

name: Tywin Lannister
description:
As one of Game of Thrones' most formidable figures, Tywin Lannister plays a pivotal role in shaping Westeros' political landscape. His influence is evident from the sacking of King's Landing during Robert's Rebellion to his strategic union with the crown, laying the groundwork for major plot developments throughout the series.

Charles Dance’s portrayal captures Tywin's commanding presence and unnerving authority, leaving an indelible impression on both characters and audience alike. He drives significant character development among those around him — challenging Jaime Lannister to prove himself as his true heir, compelling Cersei Lannister to prioritize her family above all else, and constantly reminding Tyrion of his perceived inadequacies.
memorableMoments: At Harrenhal, Tywin appoints a girl disguised as a boy as his cupbearer, unknowingly choosing Arya Stark.
In an act that irreparably damages their relationship, he arranges for Tyrion to stand trial for Joffrey's murder.
Despite his stature and power, Tywin meets an ironic end when he is murdered by his son Jaime while in the privy.

name: Varys "The Spider"
description:
Known as the Master of Whisperers, Varys plays a crucial role in Game of Thrones' intricate web of politics and intrigue. His network of informants, affectionately termed his 'little birds,' provides him with vital secrets that make him one of Westeros' most influential power players.

Varys often finds himself competing with Littlefinger as the primary architect behind many secretive manipulations aimed at achieving larger goals. He is instrumental in guiding Daenerys Targaryen on her path to power and orchestrating Tyrion Lannister’s escape from execution to align with her mission of restoring the Targaryens, all under the guise of serving 'the good of the realm.' Despite his calm demeanor, Varys remains an enigmatic figure whose true motives are perpetually shrouded in mystery.
memorableMoments: Arya Stark eavesdrops on a conversation between Varys and Illyrio Mopatis in Season 1, revealing their plans to resurrect the Targaryen dynasty.
Varys's decision to become a eunuch, following an encounter with a sorcerer who castrated him as part of a spell, marks a defining moment in his life.
In alignment with his longstanding strategy, Varys allies himself with Daenerys Targaryen and sails with her to reclaim Westeros.

name: Catelyn Stark
description:
Catelyn Stark embodies much more than simply being the matriarch of House Stark. As the Lady of Winterfell, her influence extends deeply over her husband and children, playing a pivotal role in the unfolding saga of Game of Thrones.

Her resilience is profoundly tested as she witnesses her family torn apart by tragic events, making her one of Westeros' most formidable and steadfast figures. Her descent into despair culminates tragically at The Red Wedding, marking it as one of the series' most heart-wrenching moments.
memorableMoments: Defying orders, Catelyn captures Tyrion Lannister and takes him to the Vale for trial, accusing him of Jon Arryn's murder.
In a desperate bid to ensure her daughters' safety, she decides to release Jaime Lannister, Robb Stark’s prisoner.
It is through Catelyn that we experience the harrowing realization and subsequent horror of the Red Wedding's betrayal.

name: Sansa Stark
description:
Initially perceived as the least likable member of the Stark family, Sansa's journey in Game of Thrones is transformative. Unlike her sister Arya, she yearned for a life filled with luxury and power, aspiring to be Queen. However, reality in Westeros taught her harsh lessons, through immense loss and suffering.

Sansa’s resilience becomes evident as she adapts and endures, learning to navigate the brutal world around her. She begins to master 'The Game' by leveraging Littlefinger's interest in her and ultimately orchestrates a well-deserved revenge on Ramsay Bolton, showcasing her growth from naivety to strategic acumen.
memorableMoments: Unaware of the dangers surrounding her, Sansa inadvertently betrays her father Ned Stark to Cersei Lannister in Season 1, leading to his capture and execution.
Disguised as 'Alayne,' she boldly reveals her true identity to the lords of the Vale, reclaiming her power.
After enduring Ramsay Bolton's horrific abuses, Sansa exacts revenge by having him fed to his own dogs.

name: Davos Seaworth
description:
In the ruthless world of Game of Thrones, few characters remain consistently likable and genuine without facing dire consequences. Davos Seaworth is a notable exception, though he has not been spared from sorrow and loss. Liam Cunningham's portrayal imbues Davos with a warmth and authenticity that adds humanity to the series' complex web of political intrigue and supernatural threats.

Davos, originally a smuggler who becomes an advisor to kings, serves as the moral compass for the show. This humble man is guided by a strong personal code, recognizing that what might be prudent isn’t always morally correct. He tirelessly advocates for justice and self-belief among characters often consumed by ambition.

Whether encouraging those around him or making heartfelt pleas when all else fails, Davos continually demonstrates his commitment to sacrificing for the greater good—a truly regal pursuit beyond any throne claim.
memorableMoments: As Stannis Baratheon's Hand of the King, Davos leads the Baratheon fleet into the pivotal Battle of Blackwater.
Because of Shireen’s influence on him, he becomes the one to deliver the Night's Watch’s urgent request for reinforcements to Stannis.
His crucial testimony in Season 6 secures Jon and Sansa support from Lady Mormont.

name: Brienne of Tarth
description:
In a world where warrior women are rare, Brienne of Tarth stands out as an extraordinary figure. Despite being ridiculed for her masculine appearance and unconventional femininity, she remains steadfast in her commitment to chivalry and honor. After failing to protect Renly Baratheon, who was one of the few to believe in her, she finds herself allied with Jaime Lannister—her polar opposite. Yet, against all odds, they form a unique bond that transcends their loyalties and Houses, creating one of the series' most memorable pairings.

On the battlefield, Brienne's formidable strength and mastery of Oathkeeper make her an unstoppable force, having defeated numerous foes and triumphed over the Hound in a brutal confrontation. As both unwaveringly loyal and impressively powerful, Brienne is an unforgettable character who garners admiration and support from viewers.
memorableMoments: Her quest to become a knight on Renly's Kingsguard earns her our enduring respect.
Jaime Lannister emerges as one of her most significant companions, highlighted by their iconic bath scene.
She brings the tale of 'The Bear and the Maiden Fair' to life with her battle against a bear at Harrenhal.

name: Petyr 'Littlefinger' Baelish
description:
Lord Petyr Baelish, known as Littlefinger, masterminded the conspiracy that set the events of Game of Thrones into motion. By orchestrating Jon Arryn's death—Ned Stark's close ally—he maneuvered his way into power in King’s Landing. The former Master of Coin, now Lord Protector of the Eyrie and the Vale of Arryn, is renowned for his cunning and strategic mind. His web of secrets and plots rivals that of Varys, making him a central figure in Westeros' political intrigues.

Littlefinger's actions are driven by an overarching scheme to ascend through the chaos, aiming for power at all costs. Despite his notorious reputation for betrayal, his unreturned love for Catelyn and later her daughter Sansa adds a layer of vulnerability to his otherwise deceitful persona.
memorableMoments: Littlefinger betrays Ned Stark in Season 1, setting off a chain of events leading to the elder Stark's demise with the ominous line: 'I did warn you not to trust me.'
Demonstrating his affection for Sansa, he rescues her and smuggles her out of King’s Landing.
His timely arrival with the Vale's forces at the Battle of the Bastards, orchestrated by Sansa, turns the tide in a crucial moment.

name: Joffrey Baratheon
description:
Joffrey Baratheon, portrayed by Jack Gleeson, is often remembered as one of Game of Thrones' most despised characters. His tenure on the Iron Throne saw him transform from a spoiled young prince into a sadistic and self-righteous tyrant. This gradual descent was marked by cruelty and tyranny, making his reign feel like an inevitable yet horrifying train wreck.

Joffrey's role in destabilizing Westeros is significant; he was directly responsible for key events such as the execution of Ned Stark—deciding that the 'traitor' should be executed instead of given a chance at redemption. His erratic behavior and indifference to his people’s welfare forced others around him, including Tywin, Tyrion, Cersei, and Sansa, to adapt and rise to new challenges to either mitigate the chaos he caused or simply survive under his rule.

Despite being widely disliked, Joffrey's impact on the series is undeniable. His actions set off a chain of events that reshaped the political landscape of Westeros, making him a catalyst for change throughout the story.
memorableMoments: The audience’s disdain begins when he falsely accuses Arya and her direwolf Nymeria of attacking him, leading to the death of Mycah and his own direwolf Lady.
His order for Ned Stark's execution cements his place as one of the most hated characters in the series.
A memorable scene is Joffrey's murder on his wedding day, marked by the vivid image of his face turning purple.
